Privacy Policy

Privacy Policy

Your privacy matters to Helpers Technology, Inc. (the "Company", "we", or "us"). This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, share and protect information about you. We also provide information regarding how you can access and update your information and make certain choices about how your information is used.

The Privacy Policy covers both our "online" (e.g., web and mobile services, including any web sites operated by us such as www.helpers.io, www.thehelpersapp.com, mobile applications, however accessed and/or used, whether via personal computers, mobile devices or otherwise) and "offline" (e.g., collection of data through mailings, telephone, or in person) activities owned, operated, provided, or made available by the Company. Our "online" and "offline" activities are collectively referenced as t...(line truncated)...

  1. we own or control.
  2. are available through the Services; or
  3. interact with the Services and post or incorporate this Privacy Policy.

ONCE YOU ARE USING OUR SERVICES AND PROVIDES US WITH INFORMATION, YOU HAVE AGREED TO ABIDE WITH OUR PRIVACY POLICY.

Please review our privacy policy carefully. Do not use any of our Services nor provide us your information unless you agree with this privacy policy. Moreover, please review our Terms of Use, which is related to this privacy policy.

1. What Information Do We Collect About You and Why

  • Account Information. When you download and use our mobile app, we ask you to provide a university email so that we can provide you course information specific to your college.
  • Rating Information. We collect your rating for the other user after each session in order to generate the quality of this user. This would benefit our searching process for you interact with the quality users.
  • Card Information. We collect your credit/debit card to complete transaction online. However, we do not store your information. All the information will be stored at our Third Party Payment Provider. We might also ask you to provide your phone number, address, or zip code that are necessary to the payment platform that you choose to use, such as paypal or venmo.
  • Tracking information. We ask you to share your location information from your mobile device in order to search for tutors and students closer to you.
  • Information We Collect Automatically. We may automatically collect the following information about your use of the Services: access time, device ID, application ID or other unique identifier; domain name, IP address, screen views; geo-location data (with your permission); language information; device name and model; operating system information; your activities within the Services; and the length of time that you are logged in.
  • Social Media Sites. You can like us on Facebook and promote us on other social media sites. We collect information about who has liked us, although that does not get associated with your Helpers account.

We will take action against users that are identified to have violated this honor code. If Helpers finds evidences in users’ violation, we may, in its sole discretion, terminate account of the users who were involved in cheating activities. Helpers does not take responsibility in any consequences caused by the violation of the honor code.

2. How We Use Your Information

In general, we use the information we collect about you to provide and operate the Services, respond to your requests, and to provide customer service and technical support. We may also use your information:

  • To process your registration with the Services in order to verify that your information is active and valid.
  • To send you push notifications and alerts, and to otherwise personalize your experiences while using our Services.
  • To send you emails regarding Helpers’ activities such as promotion code in your region.
  • To better understand how users access and use our Site and Services, both on an aggregated and individualized basis, in order to improve our Site and Services and respond to user desires and preferences, and for other research and analytical purposes.
  • To complete payment after each session through our application.
  • To send out invitation to your friends with your permission to get access to your contacts. We will generate a message with the Helpers download URL included.

3. How We Share Your Information

The information we collect about you, including personally identifiable information, may be shared as follows:

  • Helpers Student Users. As a student, your information, including only your preferred name, profile picture, rating, location preference, and time preference, will be shared only when you post your request on Helpers, or shared with the tutor that you have requested . You can always delete these posts, but Helpers may have a record of this post.
  • Helpers Tutor Users. As a tutor, your preferred name, profile picture, schedule information, location information, price preference, and rating will be visible to Helpers’ student users whose search criterion matches that of yours. You can always remove information from your profile that you would not like to share.
  • Service Providers. We may disclose the information we collect from you to third party vendors, service providers, contractors or agents who perform functions on our behalf.
  • Business Transfers. If we are acquired by or merged with another company, if substantially all of our assets are transferred to another company, or as part of a bankruptcy proceeding, we may transfer the information we have collected from you to the other company.
  • In Response to Legal Process. We also may disclose the information we collect about you in order to comply with the law, a judicial proceeding, court order, subpoena, or other legal process. While we don’t collect your name or contact information, we may share your IP address or other identifier, your location information, or any other information we have collected about you and your device.
  • To Protect Us and Others. We also may disclose the information we collect from you where we believe it is necessary to investigate, prevent, or take action regarding illegal activities, suspected fraud, situations involving potential threats to the safety of any person, violations of our Terms of Use or this Policy, or as evidence in litigation in which Helpers is involved.

4. Changes to This Policy

This Policy is current as of the Effective Date set forth above. We may change this Policy from time to time, so please be sure to check back periodically. We will post any changes to this Policy on our Site.
